issue.title: transpile Package SCSS

labels.name: template: story
labels.description: A user has filled out a feature request template. Will be converted to Discussions (Idea)

labels.name: area: experimental
labels.description: Issue related to an experimental feature.

labels.name: area: app
labels.description: app directory

issue.body:
### Describe the feature you'd like to request

to transpile scss modules in a monorepo you still have to use https://www.npmjs.com/package/next-transpile-modules

But the documentation indicates that the package is replaced

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add support for scss transpile to the transpilePackage functionality 
https://beta.nextjs.org/docs/api-reference/next.config.js#transpilepackages

### Describe alternatives you've considered

update the docs that you still need next-transpile-modules for scss files


### To use the appDir function it is required to remove next-transpile-modules
This results in this error
```
../../packages/ui/components/authSidebar/authSidebar.module.scss
Module parse failed: Unexpected token (1:0)
You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders
> .root {
|     --placeholder-style: 1;
| }
```

comment.body:
@balazsorban44 
Do you have any tips in how I could solve this issue?

labels.name: template: story

labels.name: area: app

issue.body:
### Describe the feature you'd like to request

to transpile scss modules in a monorepo you still have to use https://www.npmjs.com/package/next-transpile-modules

But the documentation indicates that the package is replaced

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add support for scss transpile to the transpilePackage functionality 
https://beta.nextjs.org/docs/api-reference/next.config.js#transpilepackages

### Describe alternatives you've considered

update the docs that you still need next-transpile-modules for scss files


### To use the appDir function it is required to remove next-transpile-modules
This results in this error
```
../../packages/ui/components/authSidebar/authSidebar.module.scss
Module parse failed: Unexpected token (1:0)
You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders
> .root {
|     --placeholder-style: 1;
| }
```

comment.body:
as soon as you move the ui also to the transpilePackages option then scss modules are not allowed

```
../../packages/ui/components/authSidebar/authSidebar.module.scss
CSS Modules cannot be imported from within node_modules.
Read more: https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/css-modules-npm
Location: ../../packages/ui/components/authSidebar/authSidebar.js
```

issue.title: Incorrect results because of indexed child SKUs in GraphQL Query
issue.body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

### Preconditions
<!--- Please Provide detailed informations about the environment you use -->

<!-- Magento Version : Are you using Magento CE or EE ? Which version of Magento are you using exactly ? -->
Magento Version : 2.4.5

<!-- ElasticSuite Version : Which exact version of ElasticSuite are you using ? -->
ElasticSuite Version : 2.10.11

<!-- Magento Environment : are you in Developer or Production mode ? -->
Environment : Production

### Steps to reproduce
<!--- Provide a set of unambiguous steps to reproduce this bug. You can also include pieces of code if you think it's relevant  -->
1. Create a bundle product with simple products that are visible on Catalog, Search
2. Reindex
3. execute graphql to retrieve the simple product based on the SKU

variables:
```json
filters: {
            "sku": { "eq": "childskuhere" },
        }
```
```graphql
   query GetProducts($filters: ProductAttributeFilterInput!) {
            products(filter: $filters) {
                items {
                    sku
                }
            }
        }
```

### Expected result
<!--- Tell us what should happen -->
1. if you request the child sku it should return the actual child.

### Actual result
<!--- Tell us what happens instead -->
1. The bundle product is returned

<!--- (This may be platform independent comment) -->

### Possible Solution:
#### Add child_skus to mapping
https://github.com/Smile-SA/elasticsuite/blob/6f1de645d7b4cd8f8a5551d293f953c9adc8c352/src/module-elasticsuite-catalog/etc/elasticsuite_indices.xml#L32

```xml
                <field name="child_skus" type="text">
                    <isSearchable>1</isSearchable>
                    <isUsedForSortBy>1</isUsedForSortBy>
                    <isUsedInSpellcheck>1</isUsedInSpellcheck>
                    <isFilterable>1</isFilterable>
                    <defaultSearchAnalyzer>reference</defaultSearchAnalyzer>
                </field>
```

#### Change function to use child_skus
https://github.com/Smile-SA/elasticsuite/blob/e6ac45c2112ec0a99b2373c85b1be97ad9b62bbc/src/module-elasticsuite-catalog/Model/Product/Indexer/Fulltext/Datasource/AttributeData.php#L226
```php
    private function addChildSku(&$parentData, $relation)
    {
        if (isset($parentData['sku']) && !isset($parentData['child_sku'])) {
            $parentData['child_sku'] = [$parentData['sku']];
        }

        $parentData['child_sku'][] = $relation['sku'];
        $parentData['child_sku'] = array_unique($parentData['child_sku']);
    }
```

commits.message: [FEATURE] Updated Makefile + set commit for SeosnapDashboard to latest version

Merge pull request #22 from experius/develop

Develop

[FEATURE] Updated config.json - compatible with https://github.com/experius/rendertron/commit/bcc356345d6e662289a5c2c9e8b8f81136fd2b35

 - set setUserAgentMobile to false
 - set stripSelectors to ''
 - set closeBrowser false
[FEATURE] Use experiusnl/rendertron docker image
[CI] Fixed automatic release script
Merge branch 'feature/experiusnl-rendertron-image' of github.com:experius/SeoSnap into develop
[CI] Fixed rendetron config paths in release config

Merge pull request #28 from experius/feature/experiusnl-rendertron-image

[FEATURE] Use experiusnl/rendertron docker image

Merge pull request #29 from experius/develop

Release 0.5.0
[FEATURE] updated rendertron config + README + docker-composer.yml
[FEATURE] Updated Makefile with split for cachewarmer_full and cachewarmer_queue
[FEATURE] Map mariadb with mysql volume for db
[FEATURE] updated docker-compose.yml for release with experiusnl/rendertron + 3000 as render/cache url
[FEATURE] Updated nginx.conf example with mobile switch and new param encoding + varnish example and additional user agents + Accept-Encoding

Merge pull request #30 from experius/feature/optimize-nginx-example

[FEATURE] Updated nginx.conf example with mobile switch and new param…
[BUGFIX] Updated CACHEWARMER_CACHE_SERVER_URL config to the rendertron url
[FEATURE] Updated rendertron-config.json + added examples for crontab + fix Makefile
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:experius/SeoSnap into release/0.6.0
[FEATURE] Updated the seosnap-cachewarmer & seosnap-dashboard gitsubmodules
[FEATURE] Use stable 3.2.0 release of experiusnl/rendertron

Merge pull request #32 from experius/release/0.6.0

Release/0.6.0
[BUGFIX][PWAI-659] Added force_list to prevent error when only one URL is available in the sitemap
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:experius/SeoSnap-Dashboard

pull_request.title: [BUGFIX] Prevent type error when placing an order through the API bec…

commits.message: [BUGFIX] Prevent type error when placing an order through the API because HTTP_REFERER can be empty
